TITLE: Memorial Day: 6 American heroes who gave their lives fighting for freedom
SUMMARY: For Memorial Day, find time to honor these six Americans, and the many others, who sacrificed their lives so the United States could stay a free country.

TITLE: Louisiana State Police release body cam footage of Ronald Greene's deadly arrest
SUMMARY: Louisiana authorities released a 46-minute long body-camera video Friday showing the 2019 deadly encounter between Ronald Greene and state troopers as they dragged and used a stun gun on him following a vehicle chase.

TITLE: Labor Day meaning: A brief history of the holiday and why we celebrate
SUMMARY: Labor Day marks the end of summer, and many workers are able to celebrate with a three-day weekend. The weekend is typically filled with travel, retail sales and parties.

TITLE: Yes, you can wear white after Labor Day: Fashion experts weigh in
SUMMARY: While there are many fashion "rules," it all comes down to style and preference. One of the biggest rules is not wearing white after Labor Day, which is an outdated idea.

TITLE: Razor blades and poisoned candy: A history of Americans fearing Halloween
SUMMARY: Warnings against tainted Halloween candy have been around for decades, but there's little to no evidence to substantiate the rumor. Here's how the myth might've gotten started.

TITLE: 9 ways you can save big as the host of Thanksgiving dinner
SUMMARY: Thanksgiving inflation is here, but that doesn't mean you have to spend big bucks on your favorite holiday staples. Here are nine tips for smart hosting this season.

TITLE: Simplify your Thanksgiving spread with these 1-pan side dish delights
SUMMARY: Simplify your Thanksgiving kitchen cleanup this year with three unforgettable one-pan recipes, ensuring a memorable holiday season and delicious food without all the fuss.

TITLE: Americans are divided on decorating for Christmas before or after Thanksgiving
SUMMARY: Americans across the U.S. are divided on whether or not decorating for Christmas before Thanksgiving is too early. Some put up holiday furnishings the day after Halloween.

TITLE: Hanukkah is celebrated with traditions of lighting the menorah, spinning the dreidel and eating a festive meal
SUMMARY: Hanukkah is celebrated by Jewish people around the world. The eight-night celebration is marked with many traditions, including the most popular lighting of the menorah.

TITLE: 5 things to know about MLK Jr. and the legacy of the civil rights icon
SUMMARY: Dive into the legacy of Martin Luther King Jr., a pivotal figure in the civil rights movement. Explore his journey, from challenging segregation to advocating for justice and equality.

TITLE: 10 interesting facts you may not know about Martin Luther King Jr.
SUMMARY: Martin Luther King Jr. had a strong impact on the country throughout his life and long after. He tirelessly fought for equality and social justice through peaceful methods.

TITLE: New Dem group aims to 'put the nail in the coffin of the abortion industry'
SUMMARY: Early next month, one day before the Women's March, an outspoken pro-life Democrat will launch a new organization dedicated to uniting feminists and progressives against abortion and pressuring the Democratic Party to oppose the killing of unborn babies.

TITLE: CIA forming mission to counter China, 'the most important geopolitical threat we face'
SUMMARY: Central Intelligence Agency Director William Burns announced the formation of the China Mission Center to counter Beijing.

TITLE: Putin warns NATO not to deploy troops or weapons to Ukraine
SUMMARY: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday sternly warned NATO against deploying its troops and weapons to Ukraine, saying it represents a red line for Russia and would trigger a strong response.

TITLE: ACLU livid at Biden as DOJ walks away from payments to migrant families
SUMMARY: The American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) accused President Biden of "defending the family separation practice" after the Department of Justice walked away from talks to financially compensate migrant families separated at the southern border.

TITLE: Biden's Afghan refugee request sparks conservative fears of 'unlimited green cards'
SUMMARY: The Biden administration this week made a request for $6.4 billion in funding for Afghan refugee resettlement and language that would allow for the tens of thousands of Afghans being brought in to quickly apply for permanent U.S. residency -- sparking conservative fears of "unlimited green cards" for those arriving into late 2022.

TITLE: Cruz introduces bill to bring immigrant processing centers 'where Democrat elites host their cocktail parties'
SUMMARY: Fox News exclusively obtained a press release announcing Sen. Ted Cruz’s new bill, the Stop the Surge of Unsafe Rio Grande Encampments (SURGE) Act.

TITLE: Biden-Pope Francis meeting: Vatican cancels plans for live broadcast without explanation
SUMMARY: President Biden is scheduled to meet with Pope Francis on Friday, and while the encounter was originally set to be broadcast live, that will no longer be the case as the Vatican canceled those plans without providing a reason.

TITLE: Facebook whistleblower Frances Haugen to answer questions from UK lawmakers
SUMMARY: Former Facebook data scientist turned whistleblower Frances Haugen plans to answer questions Monday from lawmakers in the United Kingdom who are working on legislation to rein in the power of social media companies.

TITLE: Alex Murdaugh's medical records in question after alleged botched shooting
SUMMARY: Alex Murdaugh lacked visible injuries during a bond hearing last month after claims he was grazed in the head by a bullet during a botched suicide plot so his surviving son could collect on a $10 million life insurance policy.

TITLE: Group that works to elect GOP officials at state level showcases record fundraising haul
SUMMARY: The Republican State Leadership Committee, a political organization dedicated to electing Republicans to state legislative and executive offices, is spotlighting what it calls a "record" third-quarter fundraising haul in an off-election year.

TITLE: Local Democrats warn party members of growing Republican wave
SUMMARY: The Democrats of Bucks County, Pennsylvania, felt the red wave building over the summer when frustrated parents filled school board meetings to complain about masking requirements and an academic theory on systemic racism that wasn't even taught in local schools.

TITLE: Biden commits multiple gaffes in commencement speech, calls VP 'President Harris'
SUMMARY: President Biden appeared at the South Carolina State University commencement ceremony Friday to speak to students of the historically Black university, where he committed several verbal gaffes.

TITLE: Violence in Solomon Islands recedes despite the government showing no signs it will address the problems
SUMMARY: Violence receded Friday in the capital of the Solomon Islands, but the government showed no signs of addressing the underlying grievances that sparked two days of riots, including concerns about the country's increasing links with China.

TITLE: Russiagate media critics react to Sussmann indictment: 'Regurgitation' of collusion claims discredits industry
SUMMARY: Some of the most prominent critics of the last decade's sprawling Russiagate news coverage are sharpening their knives after the indictment of a Democratic lawyer for allegedly lying to the FBI about a possible Donald Trump-Russia link in 2016.

TITLE: Who is Michael Sussmann, Clinton campaign attorney indicted in Durham probe?
SUMMARY: A federal grand jury indicted attorney Michael Sussmann based on allegations stemming from Special Counsel John Durham's probe of the origins of the Russia investigation, leading to his resignation from a law firm with established ties to the Democratic National Committee and Hillary Clinton's 2016 campaign.

TITLE: Pentagon: 'No question' Afghanistan withdrawal makes identifying terror threats more difficult
SUMMARY: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said there is "no question" that it will be "more difficult" to identify terror threats in the wake of withdrawing all U.S. military assets from Afghanistan.

TITLE: White House officials clarify multiple Biden comments made during live town hall
SUMMARY: The White House clarified a number of statements President Biden made during a live town hall Thursday night, walking back his vow to call in the National Guard to aid the congested supply chain and his suggestion that the United States would defend Taiwan from a potential attack from China.

TITLE: Cruz introduces bill to bring immigrant processing centers 'where Democrat elites host their cocktail parties'
SUMMARY: Fox News exclusively obtained a press release announcing Sen. Ted Cruz’s new bill, the Stop the Surge of Unsafe Rio Grande Encampments (SURGE) Act.

TITLE: Dutch leader slams rioters across Netherlands as 'idiots'
SUMMARY: Dutch caretaker Prime Minister Mark Rutte on Monday condemned rioters in Rotterdam and other towns and cities across the Netherlands over the weekend as “idiots" and said police and prosecutors would bring them to justice.

TITLE: Washington attorney general takes on nation's biggest drug manufacturers
SUMMARY: After rejecting a half-billion-dollar settlement, Washington Attorney General Bob Ferguson on Monday took the state's case against the nation's three biggest drug distributors to trial, saying they must be held accountable for their role in the nation's opioid epidemic.

TITLE: Trump says 'hats off' to Special Counsel Durham, predicts indictments are 'early building blocks'
SUMMARY: Former President Trump touted Special Counsel John Durham, predicting that the early indictments in his yearslong investigation into the origins of the Trump-Russia probe are “just the early building blocks," saying he anticipates it is “only going to get deeper and deeper."

TITLE: Raffensperger 'confident' Georgia election law will 'prevail' after seeking dismissal of DOJ lawsuit
SUMMARY: Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger said the state is prepared to fight the Justice Department's lawsuit against its election law up to the United States Supreme Court and is "confident" it will "prevail" after the state sought to dismiss the case altogether this week.

TITLE: Bruce Arians, Biden make vaccine push during Buccaneers' White House visit
SUMMARY: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers celebrated their recent Super Bowl victory with a trip to the White House on Tuesday, but President Biden took the opportunity to urge unvaccinated players to “get one."

TITLE: White House silent on if admin agrees with nominee that Omar's dual loyalty comments were anti-Semitic
SUMMARY: In 2019, President Biden’s pick to be his administration’s envoy against anti-Semitism Deborah Lipstadt said she believed Rep. Ilhan Omar’s comments from that year about U.S. lawmakers having an “allegiance to a foreign country" referred to Israel and were anti-Semitic.

TITLE: Manchin: No filibuster exception for Democrats’ voting rights bill
SUMMARY: Sen. Joe Manchin says he “can’t imagine" supporting making an exception to Senate filibuster rules in order to pass the Democrats’ wide ranging elections and campaign finance reform bill, which is a top priority for his party.

TITLE: Pentagon spokesman declines to name ISIS terrorists killed in airstrike, says 'no question' target was 'valid'
SUMMARY: The U.S. killed ISIS-K terrorists in two separate airstrikes amid President Biden's chaotic and deadly withdrawal from Afghanistan, but Pentagon spokesman John Kirby declined to give their names.

TITLE: Ilhan Omar, Keith Ellison support measure to replace Minneapolis Police Department
SUMMARY: Democratic Rep. Ilhan Omar and Minnesota Attorney General Keith Ellison have endorsed a Minneapolis ballot measure that would replace the city's police department with a new department of public safety.

TITLE: Biden heads to hometown Scranton to pitch shrinking spending agenda
SUMMARY: President Biden is traveling to his hometown of Scranton, Pennsylvania, on Wednesday to pitch his agenda amid reports that he has privately informed Democratic lawmakers that he will slash his proposed spending plan by nearly a trillion dollars in order to garner support from both progressives and moderate Democrats in Congress to get the package approved.

TITLE: Military veteran creates nonprofit to get Americans, allies out of Afghanistan
SUMMARY: A retired U.S. Army Special Forces soldier has organized a nonprofit effort to get American citizens and Afghan allies safely out of Taliban-controlled Afghanistan -- and so far, he has had success evacuating nearly 1,000 individuals.

TITLE: How US travel restrictions are changing
SUMMARY: More than a year and a half after COVID-19 concerns prompted the U.S. to close its borders to international travelers from countries including Brazil, China, India, South Africa, the United Kingdom and much of Europe, restrictions are shifting to focus on vaccine status.

TITLE: Border agent slams Biden's 'political stunt' vax mandate, says it will make border crisis worse
SUMMARY: A Border Patrol agent is requesting a meeting with President Biden to discuss the border crisis and how the vaccine mandate threatens national security.

TITLE: North Korea, 10 years after Kim Jong Il's death, says citizens should be more loyal to Kim Jong Un
SUMMARY: North Korea on Friday commemorated the 10th anniversary of former leader Kim Jong Il’s death with calls for greater public loyalty toward his son and current leader Kim Jong Un, who is struggling to navigate the country out of deepening pandemic-related hardships.

TITLE: Texas man who got over $1M in COVID funds and bought Lamborghini gets long prison sentence
SUMMARY: A Houston man has been sentenced to more than nine years in prison after he was accused of using federal COVID-19 relief funding on a Lamborghini, a Rolex watch and trips to strip clubs, federal prosecutors said.

TITLE: NASA launches spacecraft to crash into asteroid
SUMMARY: NASA launched a spacecraft Tuesday night on a mission to smash into an asteroid and test whether it would be possible to knock a space rock off course if one were to threaten Earth. The DART spacecraft, short for Double Asteroid Redirection Test, lifted off from Vandenberg Space Force Base atop a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket.

TITLE: Steele dossier sub-source Danchenko pleads not guilty to lying to FBI
SUMMARY: Russian national Igor Danchenko, charged as part of Special Counsel John Durham's investigation into the origins of the Trump-Russia investigation, pleaded not guilty Wednesday to five counts of making false statements to the FBI.

TITLE: Indictment of Steele dossier source reminds media watchdogs of news organizations who heaped credibility on it
SUMMARY: Watchdogs on both sides of the aisle feel the "now-fully-obliterated-and-exposed Steele Dossier fraud" helped corporate media push the Russian collusion narrative and news organizations that hyped it up in the first place need to be held accountable.

TITLE: COVID Christmas: Officials advise masks at home, canceling gatherings, shunning unvaxxed
SUMMARY: With rising omicron COVID cases nationwide, officials are telling Americans to take drastic COVID mitigation measures, including canceling gatherings.

TITLE: Zeldin, Republican running for NY governor, slams Hochul, Dems over mandates: 'Can't afford to survive here'
SUMMARY: Rep. Lee Zeldin, R-N.Y., doubling down on criticism of Democratic New York Gov. Kathy Hochul’s mask mandate, said he aims to flip the Empire State from blue to red for the first time in two decades come 2022 because "many New Yorkers feel like they can't afford to survive here."

TITLE: COVID-19 vaccine: Children under 12 begin receiving vaccines in some European countries
SUMMARY: Many European countries are beginning to vaccinate children ages 5-11amid the spread of the COVID-19 omicron variant.

TITLE: Emma Watson wears bra-baring outfit to interview Al Gore
SUMMARY: Emma Watson’s outfit is green in more ways than one. The actress and activist, 31, sported a midriff-baring skirt and shirt set while attending the Climate Reality event hosted by Al Gore in Edinburgh on Tuesday.

TITLE: #EmptyShelvesJoe trending on Twitter amid Biden’s supply chain crisis
SUMMARY: The hashtag #EmptyShelvesJoe shot to the top of the trending topics on Twitter Thursday amid the supply chain crisis threatening the nation’s economy and holiday shopping.

TITLE: ABC, CBS, NBC newscasts ignore Durham indictment of Steele dossier sub-source after hyping Russia narrative
SUMMARY: The latest development to come from the ongoing Durham probe received no coverage from the evening newscasts on the three broadcast networks.

TITLE: Durham charges Steele dossier sub-source with five counts of making false statements to the FBI
SUMMARY: Federal agents arrested Igor Danchenko, an analyst who contributed to the unverified anti-Trump dossier, Thursday as part of Special Counsel John Durham’s investigations into the origins of the probe into whether the Trump campaign colluded with Russia to influence the 2016 presidential election.

TITLE: US, UK, other countries ask 'those in positions of power' in Afghanistan to guarantee safety for women, girls
SUMMARY: The State Department issued a joint international statement Wednesday essentially asking the Taliban to "guarantee" the protection of women and girls in Afghanistan following the hard-line Islamic militant group’s rapid takeover of the country since the U.S. withdrawal of troops.

TITLE: Infrastructure bill faces tough hurdles in House as Dems demand massive $3.5T liberal wish list
SUMMARY: The bipartisan infrastructure bill is by no means a layup in the House of Representatives, where Democrats won't touch it until they get a reconciliation bill.

SUMMARY: A group of moderate House Democrats is circulating a letter asking Speaker Nancy Pelosi to bring the bipartisan infrastructure bill up for a standalone vote and to provide more details on how the upcoming budget reconciliation package will affect the deficit and inflation.

SUMMARY: A bipartisan group of 25 military veterans serving in Congress requested a meeting with President Biden on Monday to ask for his help finding a location for a memorial dedicated to service members who died while fighting the war on terror.

TITLE: 'Squad'-backed Dem Jessica Cisneros to run against Rep. Cuellar, moderate critical of Biden on immigration
SUMMARY: "Squad"-backed Texas Democrat Jessica Cisneros on Thursdsay announced that she will again run against Rep. Henry Cuellar in a primary, teeing up yet another battle between the moderate wing of the Democratic Party and its most progressive members.

TITLE: Feds releasing 'numerous' migrants far from southern border in 'catch and release' system 'on a grander scale'
SUMMARY: ICE is shipping migrants to field offices around the country and then releasing them into communities far from the southern border.

TITLE: Oldest US veteran of WWII celebrates his 112th birthday
SUMMARY: A Louisiana man who is the oldest living World War II veteran in the United States has marked his 112th birthday.

TITLE: How hundreds of Afghans were saved from the Taliban by veterans in a digital Dunkirk: The Last 96
SUMMARY: Veterans describe the final mission to save Afghans who protected them during the war on terror.

TITLE: How Kabul became an evacuation bottleneck and a prime terror target: The Last 96
SUMMARY: How did Kabul fall to the Taliban so quickly, and why was it the only practical way out of Afghanistan?

TITLE: New Jersey gubernatorial race tightens with six days to go until Election Day
SUMMARY: New Jersey Democratic Gov. Phil Murphy's lead over GOP challenger Jack Ciattarelli has slightly deteriorated with just six days to go until Election Day, according to a new poll

TITLE: With COP26 climate change conference underway, world leaders look toward drastic cuts in emissions
SUMMARY: To avoid catastrophic climate change, the roughly 100 heads of state attending COP26, the UN climate conference in Glasgow, Scotland, must agree to cuts that collectively equal a net global emissions reduction of greenhouse gases of 45% by 2030, according to the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change.

TITLE: Do West Virginians back Joe Manchin's opposition to Build Back Better?
SUMMARY: West Virginians who spoke with Fox News backed Sen. Joe Manchin's opposition to President Biden's Build Back Better agenda.

TITLE: Suni Lee wins Olympic gold in gymnastics individual all-around

TITLE: Gas customers react to soaring prices in Arlington, Va.
SUMMARY: Gas customers reacted to soaring prices in Arlington, Va.

SUMMARY: Republican National Committee chair Ronna McDaniel gives Fox News a preview of this week's RNC summer meeting in Nashville, Tenn.

SUMMARY: In 2019, President Biden’s pick to be his administration’s envoy against anti-Semitism Deborah Lipstadt said she believed Rep. Ilhan Omar’s comments from that year about U.S. lawmakers having an “allegiance to a foreign country" referred to Israel and were anti-Semitic.

TITLE: DOJ drops case of Vermont hospital allegedly forcing nurse to participate in abortion
SUMMARY: The Justice Department has declined to pursue a case involving a nurse in Vermont who was allegedly forced to participate in an abortion.

TITLE: College vaccine mandates: Highest court yet affirms Indiana University requirement
SUMMARY: In the highest court decision so far when it comes to college immunization mandates, a federal appeals court ruled Monday that Indiana University can proceed with its plan to require students and employees to get vaccinated for COVID-19 before returning to campus for the fall semester.

SUMMARY: House Democrats took major vote to codify right to abortion on Friday.

SUMMARY: Pro-Israel Democrats are pushing back after far-left members of the party successfully pushed to have $1 billion in funding for the Iron Dome missile defense system stripped from a spending bill last week.

TITLE: Manchin says he offered to become independent if Dems found him 'embarrassing,' never considered joining GOP
SUMMARY: Sen. Joe Manchin said Thursday that he never considered joining Republicans in the Senate.

TITLE: Biden heads to hometown Scranton to pitch shrinking spending agenda
SUMMARY: President Biden is traveling to his hometown of Scranton, Pennsylvania, on Wednesday to pitch his agenda amid reports that he has privately informed Democratic lawmakers that he will slash his proposed spending plan by nearly a trillion dollars in order to garner support from both progressives and moderate Democrats in Congress to get the package approved.

TITLE: UK experiences new normal amid pandemic while neighboring countries see COVID surges
SUMMARY: The bars are shut in Vienna, and the Christmas market is empty in Munich, as several European nations tighten up or even lock down to combat a spike in coronavirus infections.

SUMMARY: North Korea and leader Kim Jong Un opened a key political conference Monday to review past projects and discuss new policies amid the pandemic and a diplomatic deadlock with the United States.

TITLE: Blink 182's Mark Hoppus gives fans an update on his cancer treatment
SUMMARY: Mark Hoppus shared with fans that he was feeling 'much better' amid cancer treatment while speaking with fans on Twitch.

Luke Bryan reveals painful injury after fishing hook gets stuck in his finger: 'This is gonna leave a mark'
SUMMARY: Luke Bryan detailed a painful fish hook accident that occurred while on a trip with his friend on Monday.

SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump blasted Joe Biden's handling of the border crisis Saturday, saying ICE and Border Patrol were 'dying for leadership.'

SUMMARY: As New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo faces sexual misconduct allegations from two female aides, a video has reemerged on social media showing the Democratic governor questionably urged a female reporter to eat an entire sausage in front of him.
